titleFormatted.en:
Create an alarm clock for [[alarm_time]], repeat on ([[mon]], [[tue]], [[wed]], [[thu]], [[fri]], [[sat]], [[sun]]) with [[snooze_duration]] snooze and next optional parameters: 

Duration: [[sunrise_duration]],
Intensity: [[light_intensity]],
Color Scheme: [[color_scheme]],
Volume: [[volume]],
Sound Source: [[ambient_sound_source]],
Sound: [[ambient_sound]],
PowerWake ⏰: [[power_wake]],
PowerWake Start Time: [[power_wake_time]]

hint.en:
Snooze duration applies to all alarms.

PowerWake is an an extra alarm making sure you get out of bed. It wake you up with a loud sound and bright flashing light. PowerWake start time is how long after your normal alarm do you want to start PowerWake.

Duration: [[sunrise_duration]],

PowerWake Start Time: [[power_wake_time]]

hint.en:
This card will create an alarm clock for the current time (time when flow card will start) plus the delay time.

Snooze duration applies to all alarms.

PowerWake is an an extra alarm making sure you get out of bed. It wake you up with a loud sound and bright flashing light. PowerWake start time is how long after your normal alarm do you want to start PowerWake.

desc.en: If you need to synchronise your alarms now without waiting for the alarm polling interval to start, then just use this function to synchronise them immediately.

A feature of the Philips device is the rate limits for requests to the device itself, so in order to avoid reboots and still want to use the official app, please use this button to enable or disable polling.
This option will completely reset your device to factory settings.

hint.en: When deactivated, the display will automatically turn off after a certain amount of time.
This setting adjusts the frequency of the device functions and sensors polling.
This setting adjusts the frequency of the alarms polling. This value also affects the frequency of alarm updates when synchronisation with the application is enabled.

label.en: How to create an alarm clock?

hint.en:
To create an alarm from the Homey application, use the same name specified in the 'Alarms Synchronisation Name' settings field.

You can use any name for the alarm, as long as it contains this field case-sensitive. Once the alarms are synchronized and created on the device, you can rename the alarm in the app as you wish.

If enabled, alarms set in the Homey app will be created, updated, and deleted based on the alarms in your device. This works both ways, i.e. if you create an alarm in the app it will automatically appear on the device, etc.
The name of the alarm that will be used to generate alarms names in the Homey application when synchronizing the alarm clock itself and the application.
